alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 11:47AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Wyandotte, Johnson, southwestern Clay, southeastern Platte and northwestern Jackson Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Prairie Village, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Olathe, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Shawnee, Blue Springs, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Liberty, Gladstone, Grandview, Prairie Village, Merriam, Mission, De Soto, Parkville, Edwardsville and North Kansas City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 18. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 414 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 213 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 6, and between mile markers 14 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 10, and between mile markers 51 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
